questions.question: When someone says: "You have been ghosted." It means:

choices.answer: You are possessed by a ghost.
You are scared.
You were dumped by boy/girl and erased from social media.
You became invisible.

questions.question: I am feeling a little bit under the weather means:

choices.answer: I am standing in the rain.
I think it is going to be sunny.
I am depressed.
I am slightly ill.

questions.question: When I want to say that something was very simple, I can say:

choices.answer: It was a piece of fake.
I was a piece of banana.
It was a piece of cake.
It was very sweet.

questions.question: When I say: "I am sorry I let the cat out of the bag." Figuratively, I am sorry for:

choices.answer: Letting the cat out of the bag.
Telling everyone about something secret.
Felling sorry for myself.
Letting something terrible to happen.

questions.question: When someone tells you: "I cannot come to your party, I have to burn the midnight oil tonight."

choices.answer: They work in the oil industry.
They want to burn something.
They burn fat by exercising.
They work late into the night.

questions.question: If you want to say that you will be somewhere immediately, you can say:

choices.answer: I will be there at the cat of a hat.
I will be there at the drop of a hat.
I will be there in hats and cats.
I will be there at the drop of pet.

questions.question: When someone tells you: "I killed two birds with one stone." It means:

choices.answer: They are ruthless killers.
They want to become hunters.
They completed two things at the same time.
They want to throw stones at birds.

questions.question: When someone asks you for "A penny for your thoughts." They are asking:

choices.answer: For a large amount of money.
For a penny.
what are you thinking about.
What do you think about the latest financial reform

questions.question: When you add an insult to injury, you:

choices.answer: insult an injured person.
injure someone.
make a bad situation worse.
make a bad situation better.

questions.question: When you want to say that something cost you a large amount of money, you can say:

choices.answer: It cost me my head.
It cost me an arm.
It cost me a leg.
It cost me an arm and a leg.

questions.question: When someone hits the nail on the head, it means:

choices.answer: They are really skilled.
They do or say something wrong.
They are furiously hitting someone.
They do or say something exactly right.

questions.question: Your guess is as good as mine means:

choices.answer: I can't read your mind.
I do not know the questions for your answer.
I have no idea how to answer your question.
I want to guess the answer.
